content:
The chunk provides the foundational imports and setup for a Python class that subclasses `Datagram` from the `panda3d.core` module. It imports essential subatomic types (STInt8, STFloat64, etc.) from `panda3d.direct` to handle various data formats, along with specific control channel definitions like `CONTROL_CHANNEL` from `direct.distributed.MsgTypes`. This setup enables the class to manage complex data structures and communication channels effectively.

# This is built as a subclass instead of an extension so we can define the
# class variable FuncDict and so we can import DCSubatomicType at the top
# of the file rather than every time we call the putArg function.

from panda3d.core import Datagram
from panda3d.direct import (
    STInt8,
    STInt16,
    STInt32,
    STInt64,
    STUint8,
    STUint16,
    STUint32,
    STUint64,
    STFloat64,
    STString,
    STBlob,
    STBlob32,
    STInt16array,
    STInt32array,
    STUint16array,
    STUint32array,
    STInt8array,
    STUint8array,
    STUint32uint8array,
)
# Import the type numbers

from direct.distributed.MsgTypes import CONTROL_CHANNEL
